channel.title: The Times of India Sports: Extensive sports coverage, key statistics and free downloads
channel.description: The Times of India Sports gives you latest sports coverage, scores and milestones; covers all sporting events, provides key statistics and free downloads

image.title: The Times of India Sports: Extensive sports coverage, key statistics and free downloads

item.title: 'Won't change ODI rules till World Cup'
item.description: "We wanted to create a more attacking 50-over game, one that could compete on the entertainment scales with T20 cricket," says ICC CEO David Richardson.

item.title: India strangle Pakistan in opening game
item.description: India won their ninth World Cup contest against Pakistan and the fourth in the ICC World T20 when they emerged victorious in a opening Super-10 clash by seven wickets.

item.title: I always go for wickets: Amit Mishra
item.description: Leg-spinners might go for runs but that does not deter Amit Mishra from thinking about bowling an attacking line rather than trying to be a restrictive option.

item.title: '3 spinners, 2 pacers would not be norm'
item.description: Skipper Dhoni said India's ploy of going with three spinners and two pacers would not be the norm and team combination would depend on match conditions.

item.title: World T20: India maul Pak by 7 wkts
item.description: India thrashed Pakistan by seven wickets in the World T20 opener to keep their unbeaten record against the arch rivals in World Cups intact.

item.title: World T20: India maul Pak by 7 wkts
item.description: India thrashed Pakistan by seven wickets in the World T20 opener to keep their unbeaten records against the arch rivals in World Cups intact.

item.title: T20 WC: Pak fight back with quick wkts
item.description: Pakistan bounce back with three quick wickets as India lose plot after a solid opening stand during their chase of 131 in the World T20 opener.

item.title: World T20: Dhawan falls after fiery start
item.description: Pacer Umar Gul gave Pakistan crucial breakthrough by scalping Shikhar Dhawan (30) after a solid 1st wicket stand with Rohit Sharma.

item.title: I can look fans in the face again: Moyes
item.description: David Moyes said he can look Manchester United's supporters in the face again after his side's Champions League great escape against Olympiakos.

item.title: World T20: India off to a fiery start
item.description: Openers Shikhar Dhawan and Rohit Sharma got India off to a fiery start after spinners performed admirably to restrict Pakistan to a modest 130 for seven.

item.title: World T20: India restrict Pak to 130/7
item.description: Indian spinners performed admirably to restrict Pakistan to a modest 130 for seven in the opening group league game of the ICC World Twenty20 on Friday.

item.title: Mishra scalps Malik after solid stand
item.description: Leg spinner Amit Mishra struck again in the 16th over to scalp Shoaib malik (18) after his 50-run stand with Umar Akmal in the World T20 opener at Mirpur.

item.title: T20 WC: Spinners give India command
item.description: Amit Mishra removed Ahmed Shehzad just after Ravindra Jadeja got rid of Mohammad Hafeez to put Pakistan in trouble in the World T20 opener

item.title: World T20: Pakistan lose Akmal early
item.description: India struck in the second over as a brilliant throw by Bhuvneshwar Kumar saw Kamran Akmal walking back to pavilion after Dhoni elected to bowl.

item.title: World T20: India invite Pakistan to bat
item.description: While form favours Pakistan even though they were battered by South Africa in a warm-up game last evening, history would be on India's side.

item.title: Bayern to tackle United in 1999 repeat
item.description: Defending champions Bayern Munich drew Man United in a repeat of classic 1999 Champions League final as a star-studded quarterfinal draw was made.

item.title: Chelsea's Torres hints at Atletico return
item.description: Chelsea striker Fernando Torres has potentially opened the door on a return to Atletico Madrid after expressing an interest in working under Simeone.

item.title: Hope to convince Kumble on DRS: ICC
item.description: ICC CEO says the world body is hopeful of changing the Indian stand by first convincing ICC Cricket Committee chief Anil Kumble about the DRS.

item.title: Sania-Cara pair advances at Sony Open
item.description: Sania Mirza and Cara Black fought their way into the second round even as Leander Paes made a first round exit with Radek Stepanek at the Sony Open.

item.title: Maria Sharapova tested but triumphant
item.description: Fourth seed Russian Maria Sharapova, the 2013 runner-up to Serena Williams, outlasted Kurumi Nara 6-3, 6-4 in an opening test at the Miami Masters.

item.title: FIH rings dramatic changes in hockey
item.description: The International Hockey Federation (FIH) announced its decision to reduce the duration of matches to 60 minutes from its current duration of 70 minutes.

item.title: Is Captain Cool's mask peeling off?
item.description: Famously labelled 'Captain Cool' for his ability to absorb pressure like a sponge, Dhoni has started to show his displeasure at players for tiny mistakes.

item.title: Federer dresses for success on court
item.description: Speaking on the eve of his opening match at Sony Open, 17 Grand Slams winner Roger Federer said he's already contemplating options for the 2015 US Open.

item.title: India take on Pak in Friday blockbuster
item.description: Shahid Afridi will once again be a major factor as India take on Pakistan in a blockbuster opening clash of the Super 10 phase of the ICC World Twenty20 on Friday.

item.title: Didn't want to burden Sehwag: Bangar
item.description: Five of eight IPL teams have gone for Indian captains, but Punjab decided to name George Bailey as skipper even when they had Virender Sehwag in the line-up.
